meanings.sent1: She misstarted the race by tripping at the starting line.
meanings.sent2: He misstarted the project by not reading the instructions carefully.
meanings.sent3: The chef misstarted the recipe by adding salt instead of sugar.
meanings.sent4: The musician misstarted the song, but quickly recovered with a smooth transition.
meanings.sent5: The student misstarted the essay with a confusing introduction.

meanings.definition: To make a false start or mistake in starting something.
meanings.sent1: The car misstarted a few times before finally turning on.
meanings.sent2: She misstarted her speech by forgetting her opening lines.
meanings.sent3: The robot misstarted and bumped into the wall before moving forward.
meanings.sent4: The clock misstarted and struck the wrong hour.
meanings.sent5: The computer misstarted and displayed an error message.
